text: Grevillea secunda is a shrub of the genus Grevillea native to an area in the Goldfields-Esperance region of Western Australia. The shrub typically grows to a height of and has non-glaucous branchlets. It has simple dissected leaves with a blade that is . It blooms in July and produces a terminal raceme irregular inflorescence with red or pink flowers and red styles. Later it forms simple brown ellipsoidal hairy fruit that is long. ==See also== * List of Grevillea species ==References== secunda Category:Proteales of Australia Category:Eudicots of Western Australia
title: Grevillea secunda
